public static class zeta.form.Form.Style

This class is an inner class of zeta.form.Form.
(source file: Form.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.form.Form.Style
The pure class interface. 
public static class Style
The class of general form styles. Not all of them apply to all variants of forms; if a style doesn't applies, it is ignored. Note that individual forms may provide further styles.

Border(String)
Put a border around this form
Dialog(String, String)
Whether this form shall be put in a separate dialog.
FIXSIZE
Fix the size of this form to its preffered size, setting minimal and maximum size to the
HISTORY
If this is a form which provides a history, such as a TextForm, add buttons for accessing
HORIZONTAL
If this is a compound form (such as a sequence or choice), layout its components
INVISIBLE
Whether this form is invisible.
Label(String)
A label for this form
MaximumSize(int, int)
A maximal size for this form
MinimumSize(int, int)
A minimal size for this form
PreferredSize(int, int)
A preferred size for this form
Tip(String)
A tool-tip text provided for this form.
VERTICAL
If this is a compound form (such as a sequence or choice), layout its components vertically
View(int, int)
Whether this form shall be put in a scrollable view

Border
public case Border(String title);
Put a border around this form.

Parameters:
title - if non-null, use as a title embedded in the border

Label

public case Label(String stringOrIcon);
A label for this form. If given, is displayed in front of the actual form. If given for a literal form, replaces the entire display of the literal form.

Parameters:
textOrIcon - a string specifiying the label text. If starting with an @, specifies an icon. The remaining string is then used as a file name relative to the images directory of the ZETA installation
See also:
LiteralForm

Tip

public case Tip(String text);
A tool-tip text provided for this form.

PreferredSize

public case PreferredSize(int width,
                          int height);
A preferred size for this form. If the indidvidual width or height is 0, take over the defaults of the GUI. If greater then 0, take values as pixel units. If less then zero, take as units of character width/height of the default font.

MinimumSize

public case MinimumSize(int width,
                        int height);
A minimal size for this form. If the indidvidual width or height is 0, take over the defaults of the GUI. If greater then 0, take values as pixel units. If less then zero, take as units of character width/height of the default font.

MaximumSize

public case MaximumSize(int width,
                        int height);
A maximal size for this form. If the indidvidual width or height is 0, take over the defaults of the GUI. If greater then 0, take values as pixel units. If less then zero, take as units of character width/height of the default font.

FIXSIZE

public case FIXSIZE;
Fix the size of this form to its preffered size, setting minimal and maximum size to the preferred size.

Dialog

public case Dialog(String textOrIcon,
                   String title);
Whether this form shall be put in a separate dialog.

Parameters:
textOrIcon - a text used in the button to invoke the separate dialog. If starting with an @, specifies an icon. The remaining string is then used as a file name relative to the images directory of the ZETA installation
title - a text used as the title of the dialog

INVISIBLE

public case INVISIBLE;
Whether this form is invisible.

View

public case View(int horiUnits,
                 int vertUnits);
Whether this form shall be put in a scrollable view. Given are the units of scrolling. If 0, take over the defaults of the GUI. If greater then 0, take values as pixel units. If less then zero, take values as units of character width/height of the default font.

HISTORY

public case HISTORY;
If this is a form which provides a history, such as a TextForm, add buttons for accessing the history.

HORIZONTAL

public case HORIZONTAL;
If this is a compound form (such as a sequence or choice), layout its components horizontally. The default for layouting depends on the form type.

VERTICAL

public case VERTICAL;
If this is a compound form (such as a sequence or choice), layout its components vertically. The default for layouting depends on the form type.
